content: Is there any good example or recommendation about managing versioning of artefacts?
For example we have a project IG which relies on the government IG. We will need to determine whether the dependency is on the v1 or V2 of the government IG.
my first recommendation is that you understand your development lifecycle and it's relevant parts
my second recommendation is that you also understand all the possible future variants that you'll have to deal with
If the second recommendation means : "think how messy that can realistically get and try to cover the corners", I wouldn't miss that chance :)

Conformance resources are not expected to have versions, right?
So a v2 of a profile (say BEPatient v2 vs BEPatient v1) is actually another StructureDefinition, which is part of a different ImplementationGuide.

Is there some opportunity / group of interested people for such a discussion?
Or should I formulate requirements overview before any further talks
